DIP211
Assignment 2
Interactive Media Application
Release Date: 30/06/2025
Due Date: 30/07/2025
Value: 50% of final total
Submission: Individual and Group
Course Learning Outcomes
Integrate multimedia elements into an interactive multimedia application using multimedia 
authoring tool in a group work (C6, PLO6, MQF3d)
Project Video Production
1.Video Concept:
Video 1(Commercial Video – Individual):
Provide a brief overview of a new product, highlighting a service feature, 
showcasing customer testimonials. Describe how the videos align with your 
brand identity and campaign message.
Recommended completion date: 28
th
 July 2025
Duration of the video:  30 – 60 seconds
Video 2 (Theme Video – Group):
Provide a brief overview of each video’s theme and message. The theme for the 
video is “Sustainability”. 
“The 3 principles of sustainability are environmental sustainability, social 
sustainability, and economic sustainability. These principles guide us in creating 
a balanced and sustainable future for our planet and its inhabitants.”
Recommended completion date: 28
th
 July 2025
Duration of the video: 3 to 5 minutes

2.Guideline for Video Script and Storyboard:
Recommended completion date: 5
th
 July 2025
Develop a script for each video that includes dialogue, voiceovers, and key 
visual elements.
Create a storyboard outlining the sequence of scenes, camera angles, and 
transitions for each video.
The storyboard should visualize the sequence for your planned interactive 
multimedia application. Each storyboard must contain information about the 
scene name, scene description, visual design, and description of multimedia 
elements (text, graphics, videos, audio, and animations).  
3.Guideline for Production Plan:
Recommended completion date: 15
th
 July 2025
Detail the production plan, including location, props, actors, and equipment 
needed.
Set a timeline for the production process, including pre-production, filming, 
and post-production stages.
4.Technical Specifications:
Recommended completion date: 29
th
 July 2025
Specify the resolution and aspect ratio for the videos (e.g., 1080p, 16:9).
State the file format for the final video submission (e.g., MP4, MOV).
Submission Requirements:
Commercial Video
Theme Video
Rubric Marking
Compressed these files before you submit to LMS
Assessment & Criteria:
 
 Alignment with campaign message and brand identity.
 
 Creativity and effectiveness of the video concept.
 
 Technical quality and adherence to specifications.

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP211
 Interactive Media Application
Group Assignment 1
                                                                                                                                                                         
Release Date: 24/04/2025
Due Date: 30/05/2025
Value: 15% of total assessment
Marks : Marked out of 100
Assessment Mode: Group Assessment
                                                                                                                                                                         
Objective:
Create an interactive marketing campaign that effectively showcases your business idea, personal
brand, product, or service. As part of this campaign, you will design a brochure that highlights key
aspects of your promotion. Additionally, you will develop detailed Design Specifications to guide
the creation of your poster. 

Part 1: Interactive Marketing Campaign
Recommended completion date: 15
th
 June 2025
1.Business Ideas:
What is your company background?
What do you want to sell?
What is so unique about your product, company or ideas?
2.Campaign Concept:
Define the objective of your campaign. What do you want to achieve? (e.g., increase brand
awareness, generate leads, boost sales)
Identify your target audience. Who are you trying to reach? (e.g., age group, interests, location)
Describe the main message you want to convey. What is the core idea or value proposition?
3.Interactive Elements:
Explain how you will make your campaign interactive. What tools or platforms will you
use? (e.g., social media contests, interactive videos, QR codes, surveys) 
Detail the user engagement strategy. How will you encourage participation and interaction
from your audience?
4.Campaign Channels:
List the channels where your campaign will be promoted. (e.g., social media platforms,
email marketing, website, offline events)
Justify your choice of channels based on your target audience and campaign objectives.
Part 2: Brochure & Logo Design
Recommended completion date: 29
th
 June 2025
1.Design Concept:
Provide a brief overview of your brochure’s theme and visual style. (e.g., minimalist,
vibrant, retro)
Describe how the design aligns with your brand identity and campaign message.

2.Design Specifications:
A.Visual Element
Color Scheme:
oList the primary and secondary colors you will use.
oProvide the HEX codes or Pantone numbers for each color.
Typography:
oSpecify the fonts for headings, subheadings, and body text.
oInclude font sizes and styles (e.g., bold, italic)
Image:
oDescribe the types of images or illustrations you will include. (e.g., product photos,
abstract graphics) 
oMention any specific requirements for image resolution or format.
B.Layout and Composition:
Grid System:
oDesign a bi-fold brochures
oDefine the grid system or layout structure for the brochure. (e.g., tri-column grid,
modular grid) 
Hierarchy:
oExplain how you will establish visual hierarchy to guide viewers' attention. (e.g.,
placement of headings, use of contrast)
Whitespace:
oDiscuss the use of whitespace to enhance readability and visual appeal.
C.Content:
Headline:
oCraft a compelling headline that grabs attention.
Body Text:
oWrite a brief description or call to action that supports your campaign message.
Contact Information:
oInclude essential contact details or social media handles.

Submission Requirements:
1.Interactive Marketing Campaign: Presentation
2.Brochure & Logo Design:
Submit the final brochure & logo design file as specified in the technical requirements.
Provide a document with detailed Design Specifications, including visual elements, layout, content,
and technical details. 
Assessment Criteria:
1.Brochure & Logo Design:
Alignment with campaign message and brand identity.
Visual appeal and creativity of design.
Adherence to Design Specifications and technical requirements.
2.Design Specifications:
Completeness and accuracy of visual, layout, content, and technical details.
Clarity and professionalism of the specifications document.

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP105
Introduction to Computer Architecture
Group Assignment 1
                                                                                                                                                                         
Release Date: 22/05/2025
Due Date: 22/06/2025
Value: 20% of total assessment
Marks : Marked out of 100
Assessment Mode: Group and Individual Assessment
                                                                                                                                                                         
RATIONALE
This assignment has been designed to allow students to research various computing issues
implemented in the real world to solve different business requirements or real-world issues like
promoting a company. Upon completion of this coursework, students will be able to:
CLO3: Discuss computing issues based on various online resources.

CASE STUDY:
HELP university marketing department needs a video to advertise the university’s IT
programs to the public to attract more high school leavers to join. However, they have no idea
how to create an advertisement video and promote it to the public. Even though HELP university
provides fantastic Diploma and Degree IT programs, high school leavers still have less chance to
get to know more about the university’s facilities and programs offered.
As an IT student, you are required to form a group (two members in a group, if the class
students’ amount is odd number, then only one group can have three members) to create a simple
advertisement video about your own university for high school leavers. Discuss how you would
advertise your video to them through any existing information technology tools in the market.
Compare and contrast a few suitable software to be used to create your video that is available in
the market and then suggest the best software to be used with justifications.
TASKS
i.Create an advertisement video of less than 5 minutes based on the case study above. Make
sure at least FIVE (5) of the following features or any other features or animations are
included in the created video:
a.Transition and Cross Fades
b.Filter Effects and Fades
c.Improve Preview Performance with Proxy Editing
d.Keyframes
e.Adding Text
f.Picture in Picture & Split Screen
g.Record a Voice Over
Ensure the created video meets the legal, national rules & regulations and copyright
considerations.
Recommended completion: 13
th
 August 2025

ii.Write a report to discuss the following points:
a.Video advertisement methods. Each group member is required to research online and
discuss advertising methods to high school leavers.
b.Compare and contrast different software used to create videos. Each group member is
required to research online and discuss one specific video editing software, and then
conclude to justify which software is the best. Hardware requirements to support video
editing, and video processing.
Recommended completion: 28
th
 June 2025
iii.Submit your completed video file (.mp4 / .wma) and video editing file into LMS video
submission link. Only one submission from each group by one student.
Recommended completion: 29
th
 June 2025
iv.Submit your report to the Turnitin link provided in LMS.
Recommended completion: 29
th
 June 2025
SUBMISSION CHECKLIST
Softcopy submitted in LMS MUST contains all the following items:
i.Completed advertisement video (save as .mp4 / .wma format) – Group Submission
ii.Video editing file – Group Submission
iii.Report (Submit to Turnitin link provided in LMS) – Individual Submission
REMARKS
i.This assignment should be prepared using word processing software with 12 points Times
New Roman font, 1.5 spacing, and page numbering.
ii.If you are not clear about the assignment requirements, please contact the tutor.
iii.You may refer materials from textbooks or any other online references, but you must
acknowledge the quotation, no matter how brief. Failure to do so will result in zero marks
being awarded for the assignment.
iv.A penalty of 5 marks per working day (including Saturday) deduction from the marks
obtained for this assignment will be imposed for late submission.
v.Students will be awarded a failure grade for the whole course if students did not submit
any item in the submission check list.

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP211
 Interactive Media Application
Group Assignment 1
                                                                                                                                                                         
Release Date: 24/04/2025
Due Date: 30/05/2025
Value: 15% of total assessment
Marks : Marked out of 100
Assessment Mode: Group Assessment
                                                                                                                                                                         
Objective:
Create an interactive marketing campaign that effectively showcases your business idea, personal
brand, product, or service. As part of this campaign, you will design a brochure that highlights key
aspects of your promotion. Additionally, you will develop detailed Design Specifications to guide
the creation of your poster. 

Part 1: Interactive Marketing Campaign
Recommended completion date: 15
th
 June 2025
1.Business Ideas:
What is your company background?
What do you want to sell?
What is so unique about your product, company or ideas?
2.Campaign Concept:
Define the objective of your campaign. What do you want to achieve? (e.g., increase brand
awareness, generate leads, boost sales)
Identify your target audience. Who are you trying to reach? (e.g., age group, interests, location)
Describe the main message you want to convey. What is the core idea or value proposition?
3.Interactive Elements:
Explain how you will make your campaign interactive. What tools or platforms will you
use? (e.g., social media contests, interactive videos, QR codes, surveys) 
Detail the user engagement strategy. How will you encourage participation and interaction
from your audience?
4.Campaign Channels:
List the channels where your campaign will be promoted. (e.g., social media platforms,
email marketing, website, offline events)
Justify your choice of channels based on your target audience and campaign objectives.
Part 2: Brochure & Logo Design
Recommended completion date: 29
th
 June 2025
1.Design Concept:
Provide a brief overview of your brochure’s theme and visual style. (e.g., minimalist,
vibrant, retro)
Describe how the design aligns with your brand identity and campaign message.

2.Design Specifications:
A.Visual Element
Color Scheme:
oList the primary and secondary colors you will use.
oProvide the HEX codes or Pantone numbers for each color.
Typography:
oSpecify the fonts for headings, subheadings, and body text.
oInclude font sizes and styles (e.g., bold, italic)
Image:
oDescribe the types of images or illustrations you will include. (e.g., product photos,
abstract graphics) 
oMention any specific requirements for image resolution or format.
B.Layout and Composition:
Grid System:
oDesign a bi-fold brochures
oDefine the grid system or layout structure for the brochure. (e.g., tri-column grid,
modular grid) 
Hierarchy:
oExplain how you will establish visual hierarchy to guide viewers' attention. (e.g.,
placement of headings, use of contrast)
Whitespace:
oDiscuss the use of whitespace to enhance readability and visual appeal.
C.Content:
Headline:
oCraft a compelling headline that grabs attention.
Body Text:
oWrite a brief description or call to action that supports your campaign message.
Contact Information:
oInclude essential contact details or social media handles.

Submission Requirements:
1.Interactive Marketing Campaign: Presentation
2.Brochure & Logo Design:
Submit the final brochure & logo design file as specified in the technical requirements.
Provide a document with detailed Design Specifications, including visual elements, layout, content,
and technical details. 
Assessment Criteria:
1.Brochure & Logo Design:
Alignment with campaign message and brand identity.
Visual appeal and creativity of design.
Adherence to Design Specifications and technical requirements.
2.Design Specifications:
Completeness and accuracy of visual, layout, content, and technical details.
Clarity and professionalism of the specifications document.

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP103/ DIP1SAD01
Introduction to Analysis and Design
Semester 2, 2025
Assignment No : 2
Release Date : 12/05/2025
Due Date : 13/07/2025
Value : 30% of final total
Assessment Type : Group Assignment (4 - 5 students per group)
Course Learning Outcomes
This assignment assesses the following learning outcomes:
•CLO2: Produce artifacts for an information system using CASE tools (C3, PLO6, MQFC3d)
•CLO3: Describe management and security issues in the implementation of information systems.
(C2,PLO1, MQFC1)
PROBLEM STATEMENT:
Congratulations on completing Assignment 1 and creating the Project Charter for the computerized information
system! In this second assignment, you will delve into key aspects of Requirement Modelling, Process Modelling,
Data Modelling, Systems Architecture, and Systems Implementation. Each section is designed to build on your
understanding of system analysis and design concepts. Your task is to demonstrate your knowledge and skills in
each of these areas.
TASK 1: DOCUMENTATION (70 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 30
th
 July 2025
Create a document that contains the following information:
(a)Use Case Diagrams: Create a Use Case Diagram for the computerized information system. Identify the
main actors and use cases and illustrate their interactions. (10 Marks) 
(b)Context Diagram: Construct a Context Diagram that outlines the interactions between the computerized
information system and external entities. Show the system's boundaries and data flow. (10 Marks) 
(c)Data Flow Diagrams: Create a Level 0 Data Flow Diagram (DFD) for the computerized information
system. Include main processes and data flows, showing how information moves through the system.
(10 Marks) 
(d)Entity Relationship Diagrams: Construct an Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD). Define entities,
attributes, and relationships clearly. (10 Marks) 

(e)Network Models: Discuss the appropriate network model for the computerized information system.
Explain the advantages and disadvantages of the chosen model. (10 Marks) 
(f)Approaches to Implementation: Select one approach to system implementation (e.g., big bang, phased,
parallel). Justify your selection by discussing its advantages and disadvantages. (10 Marks) 
(g)User Support and Training: Discuss strategies for ensuring effective user adoption. (10 Marks)
TASK 2: POSTER (10 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 29
th
 August 2025
Create a poster that visually represents the key aspects of the computerized information system you have been
analyzing and designing. The poster will serve as a concise and engaging summary of the system's main features,
processes, and benefits. 
Your poster should cover the following main points:
•System Overview: Include a brief description of the computerized information system, highlighting its
purpose, main functions, and intended users. 
•Benefits: Emphasize the benefits and advantages of the system, such as improved efficiency, accuracy,
user experience, and overall impact on the organization. 
•Technological Aspects: Briefly mention any specific technologies, tools, or platforms used in the system's
development, such as programming languages, databases, or cloud services.
You are encouraged to use design elements that make the poster visually appealing and easy to understand. Utilize
appropriate fonts, colors, images, and diagrams to enhance clarity. The poster should be designed to fit an A3
paper size (297 mm x 420 mm). Use portrait orientation for optimal readability. Submit BOTH the HARD COPY
(laminated) and SOFT COPY of your poster as part of your Assignment 2 submission. The soft copy should be
in a common image format (e.g., JPEG, PNG) or a PDF file. 
TASK 3: PEER EVALUATION (20 MARKS)
SUBMISSION: INDIVIDUAL SUBMISSION
Recommended completion: 30
th
 August 2025
Please evaluate each group member's individual contribution to the project based on the criteria provided in the
peer evaluation form. Submit the form individually via the link provided on the HLMS. Failure to submit this
form will result in the deduction of your peer evaluation marks.

th
 July 2025

(a)Use Case Diagrams: Create a Use Case Diagram for the computerized information system. Identify the

th
 August 2025

analyzing and designing. The poster will serve as a concise and engaging summary of the system's main features,
processes, and benefits.

•System Overview: Include a brief description of the computerized information system, highlighting its
purpose, main functions, and intended users. 
•Benefits: Emphasize the benefits and advantages of the system, such as improved efficiency, accuracy,
user experience, and overall impact on the organization.

paper size (297 mm x 420 mm). Use portrait orientation for optimal readability. Submit BOTH the HARD COPY

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP211
Assignment 2
Interactive Media Application
Release Date: 30/06/2025
Due Date: 30/07/2025
Value: 50% of final total
Submission: Individual and Group
Course Learning Outcomes
Integrate multimedia elements into an interactive multimedia application using multimedia 
authoring tool in a group work (C6, PLO6, MQF3d)
Project Video Production
1.Video Concept:
Video 1(Commercial Video – Individual):
Provide a brief overview of a new product, highlighting a service feature, 
showcasing customer testimonials. Describe how the videos align with your 
brand identity and campaign message.
Recommended completion date: 28
th
 July 2025
Duration of the video:  30 – 60 seconds
Video 2 (Theme Video – Group):
Provide a brief overview of each video’s theme and message. The theme for the 
video is “Sustainability”. 
“The 3 principles of sustainability are environmental sustainability, social 
sustainability, and economic sustainability. These principles guide us in creating 
a balanced and sustainable future for our planet and its inhabitants.”
Recommended completion date: 28
th
 July 2025
Duration of the video: 3 to 5 minutes

2.Guideline for Video Script and Storyboard:
Recommended completion date: 5
th
 July 2025
Develop a script for each video that includes dialogue, voiceovers, and key 
visual elements.
Create a storyboard outlining the sequence of scenes, camera angles, and 
transitions for each video.
The storyboard should visualize the sequence for your planned interactive 
multimedia application. Each storyboard must contain information about the 
scene name, scene description, visual design, and description of multimedia 
elements (text, graphics, videos, audio, and animations).  
3.Guideline for Production Plan:
Recommended completion date: 15
th
 July 2025
Detail the production plan, including location, props, actors, and equipment 
needed.
Set a timeline for the production process, including pre-production, filming, 
and post-production stages.
4.Technical Specifications:
Recommended completion date: 29
th
 July 2025
Specify the resolution and aspect ratio for the videos (e.g., 1080p, 16:9).
State the file format for the final video submission (e.g., MP4, MOV).
Submission Requirements:
Commercial Video
Theme Video
Rubric Marking
Compressed these files before you submit to LMS
Assessment & Criteria:
 
 Alignment with campaign message and brand identity.
 
 Creativity and effectiveness of the video concept.
 
 Technical quality and adherence to specifications.

Release Date: 30/06/2025

Course Learning Outcomes
Integrate multimedia elements into an interactive multimedia application using multimedia

showcasing customer testimonials. Describe how the videos align with your 
brand identity and campaign message.

th

video is “Sustainability”.

sustainability, and economic sustainability. These principles guide us in creating 
a balanced and sustainable future for our planet and its inhabitants.”

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP105
Introduction to Computer Architecture
Group Assignment 1
                                                                                                                                                                         
Release Date: 22/05/2025
Due Date: 22/06/2025
Value: 20% of total assessment
Marks : Marked out of 100
Assessment Mode: Group and Individual Assessment
                                                                                                                                                                         
RATIONALE
This assignment has been designed to allow students to research various computing issues
implemented in the real world to solve different business requirements or real-world issues like
promoting a company. Upon completion of this coursework, students will be able to:
CLO3: Discuss computing issues based on various online resources.

CASE STUDY:
HELP university marketing department needs a video to advertise the university’s IT
programs to the public to attract more high school leavers to join. However, they have no idea
how to create an advertisement video and promote it to the public. Even though HELP university
provides fantastic Diploma and Degree IT programs, high school leavers still have less chance to
get to know more about the university’s facilities and programs offered.
As an IT student, you are required to form a group (two members in a group, if the class
students’ amount is odd number, then only one group can have three members) to create a simple
advertisement video about your own university for high school leavers. Discuss how you would
advertise your video to them through any existing information technology tools in the market.
Compare and contrast a few suitable software to be used to create your video that is available in
the market and then suggest the best software to be used with justifications.
TASKS
i.Create an advertisement video of less than 5 minutes based on the case study above. Make
sure at least FIVE (5) of the following features or any other features or animations are
included in the created video:
a.Transition and Cross Fades
b.Filter Effects and Fades
c.Improve Preview Performance with Proxy Editing
d.Keyframes
e.Adding Text
f.Picture in Picture & Split Screen
g.Record a Voice Over
Ensure the created video meets the legal, national rules & regulations and copyright
considerations.
Recommended completion: 13
th
 August 2025

ii.Write a report to discuss the following points:
a.Video advertisement methods. Each group member is required to research online and
discuss advertising methods to high school leavers.
b.Compare and contrast different software used to create videos. Each group member is
required to research online and discuss one specific video editing software, and then
conclude to justify which software is the best. Hardware requirements to support video
editing, and video processing.
Recommended completion: 28
th
 June 2025
iii.Submit your completed video file (.mp4 / .wma) and video editing file into LMS video
submission link. Only one submission from each group by one student.
Recommended completion: 29
th
 June 2025
iv.Submit your report to the Turnitin link provided in LMS.
Recommended completion: 29
th
 June 2025
SUBMISSION CHECKLIST
Softcopy submitted in LMS MUST contains all the following items:
i.Completed advertisement video (save as .mp4 / .wma format) – Group Submission
ii.Video editing file – Group Submission
iii.Report (Submit to Turnitin link provided in LMS) – Individual Submission
REMARKS
i.This assignment should be prepared using word processing software with 12 points Times
New Roman font, 1.5 spacing, and page numbering.
ii.If you are not clear about the assignment requirements, please contact the tutor.
iii.You may refer materials from textbooks or any other online references, but you must
acknowledge the quotation, no matter how brief. Failure to do so will result in zero marks
being awarded for the assignment.
iv.A penalty of 5 marks per working day (including Saturday) deduction from the marks
obtained for this assignment will be imposed for late submission.
v.Students will be awarded a failure grade for the whole course if students did not submit
any item in the submission check list.

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP105
Introduction to Computer Architecture
Assignment 2
                                                                                                                                                                         
Release Date: 23/06/2025
Due Date: 20/07/2025
Value: 30% of total assessment
Marks: Marked out of 100
Assessment Mode: Individual Assessment
                                                                                                                                                                         
RATIONALE
This assignment has been designed to allow students to test and demonstrate their understanding
and ability to explain write algorithms in the development of simple mobile applications using
App Inventor / Thunkable. Upon completion of this coursework, students will be able to:
CLO2: Construct algorithms to solve computing problems.

CASE STUDY 1
Write a pseudocode to calculate the average mark for 8 students’ Networking and Programming
courses. The program will use a while loop to accept the Networking and Programming marks for
each student, and then process all input data. In the end, output the average marks for the
Networking and Programming courses. Refer to the sample output below:
“The 8 students’ average mark for Networking course is 80, and the average mark for
Programming course is 90.”
Students will need to perform desk checking to walk through the data changes in the loop in a
Word document.
CASE STUDY 2:
Students are required to develop a simple mobile game application to let kindergarten kids
nowadays to learn in their education (Choose one lesson to teach > Mathematic / English /
Mandarin / Malay). There is no restriction on how the complete mobile application will look like
in the end, all user interface designs, and processing flow are based on the students’ creativity and
understanding. The system requirements of the mobile application are as follows:
i.The mobile app shall provide a game or application for kids to learn. (Shooting game,
snake, puzzle, collect eggs, etc......)
ii.The mobile app shall update the 5 highest scores into an online database. If the users score
a high score which overwrite one of the 5 highest scores, the app shall play music to
celebrate.
iii.The mobile app shall be able to let the users reset the game / application. If users stop /
reset the game / application while the game / application is running, no score will be
updated into the database.
iv.The mobile app shall let the users enter their name if their score is high and going to

overwrite one of the 5 highest scores.
v.The mobile app shall be able to display the top 5 highest scores in an ascending order
(Apply sorting algorithm to the program). 
TASKS
i.Construct a pseudocode program to solve case study 1 and complete the desk checking.
Recommended completion: 10
th
 July 2025
ii.Develop a mobile application using App Inventor to solve case study 2.
Recommended completion: 28
th
 July 2025
iii.Provide a video to guide users on how to use the developed mobile application.
Recommended completion: 30
th
 July 2025
SUBMISSION CHECKLIST
Softcopy submitted through LMS link MUST contains all the following items:
i.Word document contains your pseudocode and desk checking walk through.
ii.App Inventor back up file (.aia)
iii.Database backup file (depends on which online database you used, if you are using
Online TinyDB, then no need)
iv.A video file.
REMARKS
i.This assignment should be prepared using word processing software with 12 points Times
New Roman font, 1.5 spacing, and page numbering.
ii.If you are not clear about the assignment requirements, please contact the tutor.
iii.You may refer materials from textbooks or any other references, but you must acknowledge
the quotation, no matter how brief. Failure to do so will result in zero marks being awarded
for the assignment. Refer to the AI generative tools remarks below.
iv.A penalty of 5 marks per working day (including Saturday) deduction from the marks
obtained for this assignment will be imposed for late submission.
v.Students will be awarded fail grade if students did not submit any item in the submission
check list.

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP103/ DIP1SAD01
Introduction to Analysis and Design
Semester 2, 2025
Assignment No : 2
Release Date : 12/05/2025
Due Date : 13/07/2025
Value : 30% of final total
Assessment Type : Group Assignment (4 - 5 students per group)
Course Learning Outcomes
This assignment assesses the following learning outcomes:
•CLO2: Produce artifacts for an information system using CASE tools (C3, PLO6, MQFC3d)
•CLO3: Describe management and security issues in the implementation of information systems.
(C2,PLO1, MQFC1)
PROBLEM STATEMENT:
Congratulations on completing Assignment 1 and creating the Project Charter for the computerized information
system! In this second assignment, you will delve into key aspects of Requirement Modelling, Process Modelling,
Data Modelling, Systems Architecture, and Systems Implementation. Each section is designed to build on your
understanding of system analysis and design concepts. Your task is to demonstrate your knowledge and skills in
each of these areas.
TASK 1: DOCUMENTATION (70 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 30
th
 July 2025
Create a document that contains the following information:
(a)Use Case Diagrams: Create a Use Case Diagram for the computerized information system. Identify the
main actors and use cases and illustrate their interactions. (10 Marks) 
(b)Context Diagram: Construct a Context Diagram that outlines the interactions between the computerized
information system and external entities. Show the system's boundaries and data flow. (10 Marks) 
(c)Data Flow Diagrams: Create a Level 0 Data Flow Diagram (DFD) for the computerized information
system. Include main processes and data flows, showing how information moves through the system.
(10 Marks) 
(d)Entity Relationship Diagrams: Construct an Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD). Define entities,
attributes, and relationships clearly. (10 Marks) 

(e)Network Models: Discuss the appropriate network model for the computerized information system.
Explain the advantages and disadvantages of the chosen model. (10 Marks) 
(f)Approaches to Implementation: Select one approach to system implementation (e.g., big bang, phased,
parallel). Justify your selection by discussing its advantages and disadvantages. (10 Marks) 
(g)User Support and Training: Discuss strategies for ensuring effective user adoption. (10 Marks)
TASK 2: POSTER (10 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 29
th
 August 2025
Create a poster that visually represents the key aspects of the computerized information system you have been
analyzing and designing. The poster will serve as a concise and engaging summary of the system's main features,
processes, and benefits. 
Your poster should cover the following main points:
•System Overview: Include a brief description of the computerized information system, highlighting its
purpose, main functions, and intended users. 
•Benefits: Emphasize the benefits and advantages of the system, such as improved efficiency, accuracy,

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP105
Introduction to Computer Architecture
Group Assignment 1
                                                                                                                                                                         
Release Date: 22/05/2025
Due Date: 22/06/2025
Value: 20% of total assessment
Marks : Marked out of 100
Assessment Mode: Group and Individual Assessment
                                                                                                                                                                         
RATIONALE
This assignment has been designed to allow students to research various computing issues
implemented in the real world to solve different business requirements or real-world issues like
promoting a company. Upon completion of this coursework, students will be able to:
CLO3: Discuss computing issues based on various online resources.

CASE STUDY:
HELP university marketing department needs a video to advertise the university’s IT
programs to the public to attract more high school leavers to join. However, they have no idea
how to create an advertisement video and promote it to the public. Even though HELP university
provides fantastic Diploma and Degree IT programs, high school leavers still have less chance to
get to know more about the university’s facilities and programs offered.
As an IT student, you are required to form a group (two members in a group, if the class
students’ amount is odd number, then only one group can have three members) to create a simple
advertisement video about your own university for high school leavers. Discuss how you would
advertise your video to them through any existing information technology tools in the market.
Compare and contrast a few suitable software to be used to create your video that is available in
the market and then suggest the best software to be used with justifications.
TASKS
i.Create an advertisement video of less than 5 minutes based on the case study above. Make
sure at least FIVE (5) of the following features or any other features or animations are
included in the created video:
a.Transition and Cross Fades
b.Filter Effects and Fades
c.Improve Preview Performance with Proxy Editing
d.Keyframes
e.Adding Text
f.Picture in Picture & Split Screen
g.Record a Voice Over
Ensure the created video meets the legal, national rules & regulations and copyright
considerations.
Recommended completion: 13
th
 August 2025

ii.Write a report to discuss the following points:
a.Video advertisement methods. Each group member is required to research online and
discuss advertising methods to high school leavers.
b.Compare and contrast different software used to create videos. Each group member is
required to research online and discuss one specific video editing software, and then
conclude to justify which software is the best. Hardware requirements to support video
editing, and video processing.
Recommended completion: 28
th
 June 2025
iii.Submit your completed video file (.mp4 / .wma) and video editing file into LMS video
submission link. Only one submission from each group by one student.
Recommended completion: 29
th
 June 2025
iv.Submit your report to the Turnitin link provided in LMS.
Recommended completion: 29
th
 June 2025
SUBMISSION CHECKLIST
Softcopy submitted in LMS MUST contains all the following items:
i.Completed advertisement video (save as .mp4 / .wma format) – Group Submission
ii.Video editing file – Group Submission
iii.Report (Submit to Turnitin link provided in LMS) – Individual Submission
REMARKS
i.This assignment should be prepared using word processing software with 12 points Times
New Roman font, 1.5 spacing, and page numbering.
ii.If you are not clear about the assignment requirements, please contact the tutor.
iii.You may refer materials from textbooks or any other online references, but you must
acknowledge the quotation, no matter how brief. Failure to do so will result in zero marks
being awarded for the assignment.
iv.A penalty of 5 marks per working day (including Saturday) deduction from the marks
obtained for this assignment will be imposed for late submission.
v.Students will be awarded a failure grade for the whole course if students did not submit
any item in the submission check list.

development, such as programming languages, databases, or cloud services.
You are encouraged to use design elements that make the poster visually appealing and easy to understand. Utilize
appropriate fonts, colors, images, and diagrams to enhance clarity. The poster should be designed to fit an A3
paper size (297 mm x 420 mm). Use portrait orientation for optimal readability. Submit BOTH the HARD COPY
(laminated) and SOFT COPY of your poster as part of your Assignment 2 submission. The soft copy should be
in a common image format (e.g., JPEG, PNG) or a PDF file.

th

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP103/ DIP1SAD01
Introduction to Analysis and Design
Semester 2, 2025
Assignment No : 2
Release Date : 12/05/2025
Due Date : 13/07/2025
Value : 30% of final total
Assessment Type : Group Assignment (4 - 5 students per group)
Course Learning Outcomes
This assignment assesses the following learning outcomes:
•CLO2: Produce artifacts for an information system using CASE tools (C3, PLO6, MQFC3d)
•CLO3: Describe management and security issues in the implementation of information systems.
(C2,PLO1, MQFC1)
PROBLEM STATEMENT:
Congratulations on completing Assignment 1 and creating the Project Charter for the computerized information
system! In this second assignment, you will delve into key aspects of Requirement Modelling, Process Modelling,
Data Modelling, Systems Architecture, and Systems Implementation. Each section is designed to build on your
understanding of system analysis and design concepts. Your task is to demonstrate your knowledge and skills in
each of these areas.
TASK 1: DOCUMENTATION (70 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 30
th
 July 2025
Create a document that contains the following information:
(a)Use Case Diagrams: Create a Use Case Diagram for the computerized information system. Identify the
main actors and use cases and illustrate their interactions. (10 Marks) 
(b)Context Diagram: Construct a Context Diagram that outlines the interactions between the computerized
information system and external entities. Show the system's boundaries and data flow. (10 Marks) 
(c)Data Flow Diagrams: Create a Level 0 Data Flow Diagram (DFD) for the computerized information
system. Include main processes and data flows, showing how information moves through the system.
(10 Marks) 
(d)Entity Relationship Diagrams: Construct an Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD). Define entities,
attributes, and relationships clearly. (10 Marks) 

(e)Network Models: Discuss the appropriate network model for the computerized information system.
Explain the advantages and disadvantages of the chosen model. (10 Marks) 
(f)Approaches to Implementation: Select one approach to system implementation (e.g., big bang, phased,
parallel). Justify your selection by discussing its advantages and disadvantages. (10 Marks) 
(g)User Support and Training: Discuss strategies for ensuring effective user adoption. (10 Marks)
TASK 2: POSTER (10 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 29
th
 August 2025
Create a poster that visually represents the key aspects of the computerized information system you have been
analyzing and designing. The poster will serve as a concise and engaging summary of the system's main features,
processes, and benefits. 
Your poster should cover the following main points:
•System Overview: Include a brief description of the computerized information system, highlighting its
purpose, main functions, and intended users. 
•Benefits: Emphasize the benefits and advantages of the system, such as improved efficiency, accuracy,
user experience, and overall impact on the organization. 
•Technological Aspects: Briefly mention any specific technologies, tools, or platforms used in the system's
development, such as programming languages, databases, or cloud services.
You are encouraged to use design elements that make the poster visually appealing and easy to understand. Utilize
appropriate fonts, colors, images, and diagrams to enhance clarity. The poster should be designed to fit an A3
paper size (297 mm x 420 mm). Use portrait orientation for optimal readability. Submit BOTH the HARD COPY
(laminated) and SOFT COPY of your poster as part of your Assignment 2 submission. The soft copy should be
in a common image format (e.g., JPEG, PNG) or a PDF file. 
TASK 3: PEER EVALUATION (20 MARKS)
SUBMISSION: INDIVIDUAL SUBMISSION
Recommended completion: 30
th
 August 2025
Please evaluate each group member's individual contribution to the project based on the criteria provided in the
peer evaluation form. Submit the form individually via the link provided on the HLMS. Failure to submit this
form will result in the deduction of your peer evaluation marks.

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP105
Introduction to Computer Architecture
Assignment 2
                                                                                                                                                                         
Release Date: 23/06/2025
Due Date: 20/07/2025
Value: 30% of total assessment
Marks: Marked out of 100
Assessment Mode: Individual Assessment
                                                                                                                                                                         
RATIONALE
This assignment has been designed to allow students to test and demonstrate their understanding
and ability to explain write algorithms in the development of simple mobile applications using
App Inventor / Thunkable. Upon completion of this coursework, students will be able to:
CLO2: Construct algorithms to solve computing problems.

CASE STUDY 1
Write a pseudocode to calculate the average mark for 8 students’ Networking and Programming
courses. The program will use a while loop to accept the Networking and Programming marks for
each student, and then process all input data. In the end, output the average marks for the
Networking and Programming courses. Refer to the sample output below:
“The 8 students’ average mark for Networking course is 80, and the average mark for
Programming course is 90.”
Students will need to perform desk checking to walk through the data changes in the loop in a
Word document.
CASE STUDY 2:
Students are required to develop a simple mobile game application to let kindergarten kids
nowadays to learn in their education (Choose one lesson to teach > Mathematic / English /
Mandarin / Malay). There is no restriction on how the complete mobile application will look like
in the end, all user interface designs, and processing flow are based on the students’ creativity and
understanding. The system requirements of the mobile application are as follows:
i.The mobile app shall provide a game or application for kids to learn. (Shooting game,
snake, puzzle, collect eggs, etc......)
ii.The mobile app shall update the 5 highest scores into an online database. If the users score
a high score which overwrite one of the 5 highest scores, the app shall play music to
celebrate.
iii.The mobile app shall be able to let the users reset the game / application. If users stop /
reset the game / application while the game / application is running, no score will be
updated into the database.
iv.The mobile app shall let the users enter their name if their score is high and going to

overwrite one of the 5 highest scores.
v.The mobile app shall be able to display the top 5 highest scores in an ascending order
(Apply sorting algorithm to the program). 
TASKS
i.Construct a pseudocode program to solve case study 1 and complete the desk checking.
Recommended completion: 10
th
 July 2025
ii.Develop a mobile application using App Inventor to solve case study 2.
Recommended completion: 28
th
 July 2025
iii.Provide a video to guide users on how to use the developed mobile application.
Recommended completion: 30
th
 July 2025
SUBMISSION CHECKLIST
Softcopy submitted through LMS link MUST contains all the following items:
i.Word document contains your pseudocode and desk checking walk through.
ii.App Inventor back up file (.aia)
iii.Database backup file (depends on which online database you used, if you are using
Online TinyDB, then no need)
iv.A video file.
REMARKS
i.This assignment should be prepared using word processing software with 12 points Times
New Roman font, 1.5 spacing, and page numbering.
ii.If you are not clear about the assignment requirements, please contact the tutor.
iii.You may refer materials from textbooks or any other references, but you must acknowledge
the quotation, no matter how brief. Failure to do so will result in zero marks being awarded
for the assignment. Refer to the AI generative tools remarks below.
iv.A penalty of 5 marks per working day (including Saturday) deduction from the marks
obtained for this assignment will be imposed for late submission.
v.Students will be awarded fail grade if students did not submit any item in the submission
check list.

Course Learning Outcomes

showcasing customer testimonials. Describe how the videos align with your 
brand identity and campaign message.
Recommended completion date: 28
th
 July 2025
Duration of the video:  30 – 60 seconds
Video 2 (Theme Video – Group):
Provide a brief overview of each video’s theme and message. The theme for the 
video is “Sustainability”. 
“The 3 principles of sustainability are environmental sustainability, social 
sustainability, and economic sustainability. These principles guide us in creating 
a balanced and sustainable future for our planet and its inhabitants.”
Recommended completion date: 28
th
 July 2025
Duration of the video: 3 to 5 minutes

2.Guideline for Video Script and Storyboard:
Recommended completion date: 5
th
 July 2025

visual elements.
Create a storyboard outlining the sequence of scenes, camera angles, and 
transitions for each video.
The storyboard should visualize the sequence for your planned interactive 
multimedia application. Each storyboard must contain information about the 
scene name, scene description, visual design, and description of multimedia 
elements (text, graphics, videos, audio, and animations).

Recommended completion date: 15
th

needed.

and post-production stages.
4.Technical Specifications:
Recommended completion date: 29
th
 July 2025
Specify the resolution and aspect ratio for the videos (e.g., 1080p, 16:9).
State the file format for the final video submission (e.g., MP4, MOV).
Submission Requirements:
Commercial Video

Rubric Marking
Compressed these files before you submit to LMS

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP105
Introduction to Computer Architecture
Group Assignment 1
                                                                                                                                                                         
Release Date: 22/05/2025
Due Date: 22/06/2025
Value: 20% of total assessment
Marks : Marked out of 100
Assessment Mode: Group and Individual Assessment
                                                                                                                                                                         
RATIONALE
This assignment has been designed to allow students to research various computing issues
implemented in the real world to solve different business requirements or real-world issues like
promoting a company. Upon completion of this coursework, students will be able to:
CLO3: Discuss computing issues based on various online resources.

CASE STUDY:
HELP university marketing department needs a video to advertise the university’s IT
programs to the public to attract more high school leavers to join. However, they have no idea
how to create an advertisement video and promote it to the public. Even though HELP university
provides fantastic Diploma and Degree IT programs, high school leavers still have less chance to
get to know more about the university’s facilities and programs offered.
As an IT student, you are required to form a group (two members in a group, if the class
students’ amount is odd number, then only one group can have three members) to create a simple
advertisement video about your own university for high school leavers. Discuss how you would
advertise your video to them through any existing information technology tools in the market.
Compare and contrast a few suitable software to be used to create your video that is available in
the market and then suggest the best software to be used with justifications.
TASKS
i.Create an advertisement video of less than 5 minutes based on the case study above. Make
sure at least FIVE (5) of the following features or any other features or animations are
included in the created video:
a.Transition and Cross Fades
b.Filter Effects and Fades
c.Improve Preview Performance with Proxy Editing
d.Keyframes
e.Adding Text
f.Picture in Picture & Split Screen
g.Record a Voice Over
Ensure the created video meets the legal, national rules & regulations and copyright
considerations.
Recommended completion: 13
th
 August 2025

ii.Write a report to discuss the following points:
a.Video advertisement methods. Each group member is required to research online and
discuss advertising methods to high school leavers.
b.Compare and contrast different software used to create videos. Each group member is
required to research online and discuss one specific video editing software, and then
conclude to justify which software is the best. Hardware requirements to support video
editing, and video processing.
Recommended completion: 28
th
 June 2025
iii.Submit your completed video file (.mp4 / .wma) and video editing file into LMS video
submission link. Only one submission from each group by one student.
Recommended completion: 29
th
 June 2025
iv.Submit your report to the Turnitin link provided in LMS.
Recommended completion: 29
th
 June 2025
SUBMISSION CHECKLIST
Softcopy submitted in LMS MUST contains all the following items:
i.Completed advertisement video (save as .mp4 / .wma format) – Group Submission
ii.Video editing file – Group Submission
iii.Report (Submit to Turnitin link provided in LMS) – Individual Submission
REMARKS
i.This assignment should be prepared using word processing software with 12 points Times
New Roman font, 1.5 spacing, and page numbering.
ii.If you are not clear about the assignment requirements, please contact the tutor.
iii.You may refer materials from textbooks or any other online references, but you must
acknowledge the quotation, no matter how brief. Failure to do so will result in zero marks
being awarded for the assignment.
iv.A penalty of 5 marks per working day (including Saturday) deduction from the marks
obtained for this assignment will be imposed for late submission.
v.Students will be awarded a failure grade for the whole course if students did not submit
any item in the submission check list.

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP103/ DIP1SAD01
Introduction to Analysis and Design
Semester 2, 2025
Assignment No : 2
Release Date : 12/05/2025
Due Date : 13/07/2025
Value : 30% of final total
Assessment Type : Group Assignment (4 - 5 students per group)
Course Learning Outcomes
This assignment assesses the following learning outcomes:
•CLO2: Produce artifacts for an information system using CASE tools (C3, PLO6, MQFC3d)
•CLO3: Describe management and security issues in the implementation of information systems.
(C2,PLO1, MQFC1)
PROBLEM STATEMENT:
Congratulations on completing Assignment 1 and creating the Project Charter for the computerized information
system! In this second assignment, you will delve into key aspects of Requirement Modelling, Process Modelling,
Data Modelling, Systems Architecture, and Systems Implementation. Each section is designed to build on your
understanding of system analysis and design concepts. Your task is to demonstrate your knowledge and skills in
each of these areas.
TASK 1: DOCUMENTATION (70 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 30
th
 July 2025
Create a document that contains the following information:
(a)Use Case Diagrams: Create a Use Case Diagram for the computerized information system. Identify the
main actors and use cases and illustrate their interactions. (10 Marks) 
(b)Context Diagram: Construct a Context Diagram that outlines the interactions between the computerized
information system and external entities. Show the system's boundaries and data flow. (10 Marks) 
(c)Data Flow Diagrams: Create a Level 0 Data Flow Diagram (DFD) for the computerized information
system. Include main processes and data flows, showing how information moves through the system.
(10 Marks) 
(d)Entity Relationship Diagrams: Construct an Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD). Define entities,
attributes, and relationships clearly. (10 Marks) 

(e)Network Models: Discuss the appropriate network model for the computerized information system.
Explain the advantages and disadvantages of the chosen model. (10 Marks) 
(f)Approaches to Implementation: Select one approach to system implementation (e.g., big bang, phased,
parallel). Justify your selection by discussing its advantages and disadvantages. (10 Marks) 
(g)User Support and Training: Discuss strategies for ensuring effective user adoption. (10 Marks)
TASK 2: POSTER (10 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 29
th
 August 2025
Create a poster that visually represents the key aspects of the computerized information system you have been
analyzing and designing. The poster will serve as a concise and engaging summary of the system's main features,
processes, and benefits. 
Your poster should cover the following main points:
•System Overview: Include a brief description of the computerized information system, highlighting its
purpose, main functions, and intended users. 
•Benefits: Emphasize the benefits and advantages of the system, such as improved efficiency, accuracy,
user experience, and overall impact on the organization. 
•Technological Aspects: Briefly mention any specific technologies, tools, or platforms used in the system's
development, such as programming languages, databases, or cloud services.
You are encouraged to use design elements that make the poster visually appealing and easy to understand. Utilize
appropriate fonts, colors, images, and diagrams to enhance clarity. The poster should be designed to fit an A3
paper size (297 mm x 420 mm). Use portrait orientation for optimal readability. Submit BOTH the HARD COPY
(laminated) and SOFT COPY of your poster as part of your Assignment 2 submission. The soft copy should be
in a common image format (e.g., JPEG, PNG) or a PDF file. 
TASK 3: PEER EVALUATION (20 MARKS)
SUBMISSION: INDIVIDUAL SUBMISSION
Recommended completion: 30
th
 August 2025
Please evaluate each group member's individual contribution to the project based on the criteria provided in the
peer evaluation form. Submit the form individually via the link provided on the HLMS. Failure to submit this
form will result in the deduction of your peer evaluation marks.

form will result in the deduction of your peer evaluation marks.

DIP211
Assignment 2
Interactive Media Application
Release Date: 30/06/2025
Due Date: 30/07/2025
Value: 50% of final total
Submission: Individual and Group
Course Learning Outcomes
Integrate multimedia elements into an interactive multimedia application using multimedia 
authoring tool in a group work (C6, PLO6, MQF3d)
Project Video Production
1.Video Concept:
Video 1(Commercial Video – Individual):
Provide a brief overview of a new product, highlighting a service feature, 
showcasing customer testimonials. Describe how the videos align with your 
brand identity and campaign message.
Recommended completion date: 28
th
 July 2025
Duration of the video:  30 – 60 seconds
Video 2 (Theme Video – Group):
Provide a brief overview of each video’s theme and message. The theme for the 
video is “Sustainability”. 
“The 3 principles of sustainability are environmental sustainability, social 
sustainability, and economic sustainability. These principles guide us in creating 
a balanced and sustainable future for our planet and its inhabitants.”
Recommended completion date: 28
th
 July 2025
Duration of the video: 3 to 5 minutes

2.Guideline for Video Script and Storyboard:
Recommended completion date: 5
th
 July 2025
Develop a script for each video that includes dialogue, voiceovers, and key 
visual elements.
Create a storyboard outlining the sequence of scenes, camera angles, and 
transitions for each video.
The storyboard should visualize the sequence for your planned interactive 
multimedia application. Each storyboard must contain information about the 
scene name, scene description, visual design, and description of multimedia 
elements (text, graphics, videos, audio, and animations).  
3.Guideline for Production Plan:
Recommended completion date: 15
th
 July 2025
Detail the production plan, including location, props, actors, and equipment 
needed.
Set a timeline for the production process, including pre-production, filming, 
and post-production stages.
4.Technical Specifications:
Recommended completion date: 29
th
 July 2025
Specify the resolution and aspect ratio for the videos (e.g., 1080p, 16:9).
State the file format for the final video submission (e.g., MP4, MOV).
Submission Requirements:
Commercial Video
Theme Video
Rubric Marking
Compressed these files before you submit to LMS

 Alignment with campaign message and brand identity.
 
 Creativity and effectiveness of the video concept.
 
 Technical quality and adherence to specifications.

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP105
Introduction to Computer Architecture
Assignment 2
                                                                                                                                                                         
Release Date: 23/06/2025
Due Date: 20/07/2025
Value: 30% of total assessment
Marks: Marked out of 100
Assessment Mode: Individual Assessment
                                                                                                                                                                         
RATIONALE
This assignment has been designed to allow students to test and demonstrate their understanding
and ability to explain write algorithms in the development of simple mobile applications using
App Inventor / Thunkable. Upon completion of this coursework, students will be able to:
CLO2: Construct algorithms to solve computing problems.

CASE STUDY 1
Write a pseudocode to calculate the average mark for 8 students’ Networking and Programming
courses. The program will use a while loop to accept the Networking and Programming marks for
each student, and then process all input data. In the end, output the average marks for the
Networking and Programming courses. Refer to the sample output below:
“The 8 students’ average mark for Networking course is 80, and the average mark for
Programming course is 90.”
Students will need to perform desk checking to walk through the data changes in the loop in a
Word document.
CASE STUDY 2:
Students are required to develop a simple mobile game application to let kindergarten kids
nowadays to learn in their education (Choose one lesson to teach > Mathematic / English /
Mandarin / Malay). There is no restriction on how the complete mobile application will look like
in the end, all user interface designs, and processing flow are based on the students’ creativity and
understanding. The system requirements of the mobile application are as follows:
i.The mobile app shall provide a game or application for kids to learn. (Shooting game,
snake, puzzle, collect eggs, etc......)
ii.The mobile app shall update the 5 highest scores into an online database. If the users score
a high score which overwrite one of the 5 highest scores, the app shall play music to
celebrate.
iii.The mobile app shall be able to let the users reset the game / application. If users stop /
reset the game / application while the game / application is running, no score will be
updated into the database.
iv.The mobile app shall let the users enter their name if their score is high and going to

overwrite one of the 5 highest scores.
v.The mobile app shall be able to display the top 5 highest scores in an ascending order
(Apply sorting algorithm to the program). 
TASKS
i.Construct a pseudocode program to solve case study 1 and complete the desk checking.
Recommended completion: 10
th
 July 2025
ii.Develop a mobile application using App Inventor to solve case study 2.
Recommended completion: 28
th
 July 2025
iii.Provide a video to guide users on how to use the developed mobile application.
Recommended completion: 30
th
 July 2025
SUBMISSION CHECKLIST
Softcopy submitted through LMS link MUST contains all the following items:
i.Word document contains your pseudocode and desk checking walk through.
ii.App Inventor back up file (.aia)
iii.Database backup file (depends on which online database you used, if you are using
Online TinyDB, then no need)
iv.A video file.
REMARKS
i.This assignment should be prepared using word processing software with 12 points Times
New Roman font, 1.5 spacing, and page numbering.
ii.If you are not clear about the assignment requirements, please contact the tutor.
iii.You may refer materials from textbooks or any other references, but you must acknowledge
the quotation, no matter how brief. Failure to do so will result in zero marks being awarded
for the assignment. Refer to the AI generative tools remarks below.
iv.A penalty of 5 marks per working day (including Saturday) deduction from the marks
obtained for this assignment will be imposed for late submission.
v.Students will be awarded fail grade if students did not submit any item in the submission
check list.

You are encouraged to use design elements that make the poster visually appealing and easy to understand

Due Date : 13/07/2025
Value : 30% of final total
Assessment Type : Group Assignment (4 - 5 students per group)
Course Learning Outcomes
This assignment assesses the following learning outcomes:
•CLO2: Produce artifacts for an information system using CASE tools (C3, PLO6, MQFC3d)
•CLO3: Describe management and security issues in the implementation of information systems.
(C2,PLO1, MQFC1)
PROBLEM STATEMENT:
Congratulations on completing Assignment 1 and creating the Project Charter for the computerized information
system! In this second assignment, you will delve into key aspects of Requirement Modelling, Process Modelling,
Data Modelling, Systems Architecture, and Systems Implementation. Each section is designed to build on your
understanding of system analysis and design concepts. Your task is to demonstrate your knowledge and skills in
each of these areas.
TASK 1: DOCUMENTATION (70 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 30
th
 July 2025
Create a document that contains the following information:
(a)Use Case Diagrams: Create a Use Case Diagram for the computerized information system. Identify the
main actors and use cases and illustrate their interactions. (10 Marks) 
(b)Context Diagram: Construct a Context Diagram that outlines the interactions between the computerized
information system and external entities. Show the system's boundaries and data flow. (10 Marks) 
(c)Data Flow Diagrams: Create a Level 0 Data Flow Diagram (DFD) for the computerized information
system. Include main processes and data flows, showing how information moves through the system.
(10 Marks) 
(d)Entity Relationship Diagrams: Construct an Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD). Define entities,
attributes, and relationships clearly. (10 Marks) 

(e)Network Models: Discuss the appropriate network model for the computerized information system.
Explain the advantages and disadvantages of the chosen model. (10 Marks) 
(f)Approaches to Implementation: Select one approach to system implementation (e.g., big bang, phased,
parallel). Justify your selection by discussing its advantages and disadvantages. (10 Marks) 
(g)User Support and Training: Discuss strategies for ensuring effective user adoption. (10 Marks)
TASK 2: POSTER (10 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 29
th
 August 2025
Create a poster that visually represents the key aspects of the computerized information system you have been
analyzing and designing. The poster will serve as a concise and engaging summary of the system's main features,
processes, and benefits. 
Your poster should cover the following main points:
•System Overview: Include a brief description of the computerized information system, highlighting its
purpose, main functions, and intended users. 
•Benefits: Emphasize the benefits and advantages of the system, such as improved efficiency, accuracy,
user experience, and overall impact on the organization. 
•Technological Aspects: Briefly mention any specific technologies, tools, or platforms used in the system's
development, such as programming languages, databases, or cloud services.
You are encouraged to use design elements that make the poster visually appealing and easy to understand. Utilize
appropriate fonts, colors, images, and diagrams to enhance clarity. The poster should be designed to fit an A3
paper size (297 mm x 420 mm). Use portrait orientation for optimal readability. Submit BOTH the HARD COPY
(laminated) and SOFT COPY of your poster as part of your Assignment 2 submission. The soft copy should be
in a common image format (e.g., JPEG, PNG) or a PDF file. 
TASK 3: PEER EVALUATION (20 MARKS)
SUBMISSION: INDIVIDUAL SUBMISSION
Recommended completion: 30
th
 August 2025
Please evaluate each group member's individual contribution to the project based on the criteria provided in the
peer evaluation form. Submit the form individually via the link provided on the HLMS. Failure to submit this
form will result in the deduction of your peer evaluation marks.

th
 August 2025
Create a poster that visually represents the key aspects of the computerized information system you have been
analyzing and designing. The poster will serve as a concise and engaging summary of the system's main features,
processes, and benefits. 
Your poster should cover the following main points:
•System Overview: Include a brief description of the computerized information system, highlighting its
purpose, main functions, and intended users. 
•Benefits: Emphasize the benefits and advantages of the system, such as improved efficiency, accuracy,
user experience, and overall impact on the organization. 
•Technological Aspects: Briefly mention any specific technologies, tools, or platforms used in the system's
development, such as programming languages, databases, or cloud services.
You are encouraged to use design elements that make the poster visually appealing and easy to understand. Utilize
appropriate fonts, colors, images, and diagrams to enhance clarity. The poster should be designed to fit an A3
paper size (297 mm x 420 mm). Use portrait orientation for optimal readability. Submit BOTH the HARD COPY
(laminated) and SOFT COPY of your poster as part of your Assignment 2 submission. The soft copy should be
in a common image format (e.g., JPEG, PNG) or a PDF file. 
TASK 3: PEER EVALUATION (20 MARKS)
SUBMISSION: INDIVIDUAL SUBMISSION
Recommended completion: 30
th
 August 2025
Please evaluate each group member's individual contribution to the project based on the criteria provided in the
peer evaluation form. Submit the form individually via the link provided on the HLMS. Failure to submit this
form will result in the deduction of your peer evaluation marks.

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP105
Introduction to Computer Architecture
Assignment 2
                                                                                                                                                                         
Release Date: 23/06/2025
Due Date: 20/07/2025
Value: 30% of total assessment
Marks: Marked out of 100
Assessment Mode: Individual Assessment
                                                                                                                                                                         
RATIONALE
This assignment has been designed to allow students to test and demonstrate their understanding
and ability to explain write algorithms in the development of simple mobile applications using
App Inventor / Thunkable. Upon completion of this coursework, students will be able to:
CLO2: Construct algorithms to solve computing problems.

CASE STUDY 1
Write a pseudocode to calculate the average mark for 8 students’ Networking and Programming
courses. The program will use a while loop to accept the Networking and Programming marks for
each student, and then process all input data. In the end, output the average marks for the
Networking and Programming courses. Refer to the sample output below:
“The 8 students’ average mark for Networking course is 80, and the average mark for
Programming course is 90.”
Students will need to perform desk checking to walk through the data changes in the loop in a
Word document.
CASE STUDY 2:
Students are required to develop a simple mobile game application to let kindergarten kids
nowadays to learn in their education (Choose one lesson to teach > Mathematic / English /
Mandarin / Malay). There is no restriction on how the complete mobile application will look like
in the end, all user interface designs, and processing flow are based on the students’ creativity and
understanding. The system requirements of the mobile application are as follows:
i.The mobile app shall provide a game or application for kids to learn. (Shooting game,
snake, puzzle, collect eggs, etc......)
ii.The mobile app shall update the 5 highest scores into an online database. If the users score
a high score which overwrite one of the 5 highest scores, the app shall play music to
celebrate.
iii.The mobile app shall be able to let the users reset the game / application. If users stop /
reset the game / application while the game / application is running, no score will be
updated into the database.
iv.The mobile app shall let the users enter their name if their score is high and going to

overwrite one of the 5 highest scores.
v.The mobile app shall be able to display the top 5 highest scores in an ascending order
(Apply sorting algorithm to the program). 
TASKS
i.Construct a pseudocode program to solve case study 1 and complete the desk checking.
Recommended completion: 10
th
 July 2025
ii.Develop a mobile application using App Inventor to solve case study 2.
Recommended completion: 28
th
 July 2025
iii.Provide a video to guide users on how to use the developed mobile application.
Recommended completion: 30
th
 July 2025
SUBMISSION CHECKLIST
Softcopy submitted through LMS link MUST contains all the following items:
i.Word document contains your pseudocode and desk checking walk through.
ii.App Inventor back up file (.aia)
iii.Database backup file (depends on which online database you used, if you are using
Online TinyDB, then no need)
iv.A video file.
REMARKS
i.This assignment should be prepared using word processing software with 12 points Times
New Roman font, 1.5 spacing, and page numbering.
ii.If you are not clear about the assignment requirements, please contact the tutor.
iii.You may refer materials from textbooks or any other references, but you must acknowledge
the quotation, no matter how brief. Failure to do so will result in zero marks being awarded
for the assignment. Refer to the AI generative tools remarks below.
iv.A penalty of 5 marks per working day (including Saturday) deduction from the marks
obtained for this assignment will be imposed for late submission.
v.Students will be awarded fail grade if students did not submit any item in the submission
check list.

DIP211
Assignment 2
Interactive Media Application
Release Date: 30/06/2025
Due Date: 30/07/2025
Value: 50% of final total
Submission: Individual and Group
Course Learning Outcomes
Integrate multimedia elements into an interactive multimedia application using multimedia 
authoring tool in a group work (C6, PLO6, MQF3d)
Project Video Production
1.Video Concept:
Video 1(Commercial Video – Individual):
Provide a brief overview of a new product, highlighting a service feature, 
showcasing customer testimonials. Describe how the videos align with your 
brand identity and campaign message.
Recommended completion date: 28
th
 July 2025
Duration of the video:  30 – 60 seconds
Video 2 (Theme Video – Group):
Provide a brief overview of each video’s theme and message. The theme for the 
video is “Sustainability”. 
“The 3 principles of sustainability are environmental sustainability, social 
sustainability, and economic sustainability. These principles guide us in creating 
a balanced and sustainable future for our planet and its inhabitants.”
Recommended completion date: 28
th
 July 2025
Duration of the video: 3 to 5 minutes

2.Guideline for Video Script and Storyboard:
Recommended completion date: 5
th
 July 2025
Develop a script for each video that includes dialogue, voiceovers, and key 
visual elements.
Create a storyboard outlining the sequence of scenes, camera angles, and 
transitions for each video.
The storyboard should visualize the sequence for your planned interactive 
multimedia application. Each storyboard must contain information about the 
scene name, scene description, visual design, and description of multimedia 
elements (text, graphics, videos, audio, and animations).  
3.Guideline for Production Plan:
Recommended completion date: 15
th
 July 2025
Detail the production plan, including location, props, actors, and equipment 
needed.
Set a timeline for the production process, including pre-production, filming, 
and post-production stages.
4.Technical Specifications:
Recommended completion date: 29
th
 July 2025
Specify the resolution and aspect ratio for the videos (e.g., 1080p, 16:9).
State the file format for the final video submission (e.g., MP4, MOV).
Submission Requirements:
Commercial Video
Theme Video
Rubric Marking
Compressed these files before you submit to LMS
Assessment & Criteria:
 
 Alignment with campaign message and brand identity.
 
 Creativity and effectiveness of the video concept.
 
 Technical quality and adherence to specifications.
